author: GreenBets
body:
There is no herd immunity. 🌈🐻

>COVID-19 re-infection by a phylogenetically distinct SARS-coronavirus-2 strain confirmed by whole genome sequencing

https://academic.oup.com/cid/advance-article/doi/10.1093/cid/ciaa1275/5897019

>A Case of Early Re-infection with SARS-CoV-2

https://academic.oup.com/cid/advance-article/doi/10.1093/cid/ciaa1436/5908892

>Seasonal coronavirus protective immunity is short-lasting. Reinfection with the same seasonal coronavirus occurred frequently

https://www.nature.com/articles/s41591-020-1083-1

>Catalonia reports four cases of Covid-19 reinfection, with one patient in intensive care

https://english.elpais.com/society/2020-09-14/catalonia-reports-four-cases-of-covid-19-reinfection-with-one-patient-in-intensive-care.html

>Covid re-infection alarm in Raipur, cop among 5 hit by virus again

https://m.timesofindia.com/city/raipur/covid-re-infection-alarm-in-raipur-cop-among-5-hit-by-virus-again/amp_articleshow/78201178.cms

>Few people develop 'potent level' of antibodies from COVID-19
 https://www.newshub.co.nz/home/world/2020/09/coronavirus-few-people-develop-potent-level-of-antibodies-from-covid-19-reinfection-could-be-much-worse-study.html

>Several (15) cases of reinfection observed by the ANSS

https://actujeune.com/2020/09/09/attention-vous-pouvez-guerir-du-covid-19-et-retomber-malade-plusieurs-cas-de-reinfection-constates-par-lanss/

>Worry heightens as many (6) doctors in Assam “re-infected” by Covid-19

https://pragnews.com/worry-heightens-as-many-doctors-in-assam-re-infected-by-covid-19/

>Just 6% of Britons have antibodies - and levels wane over two months, SAGE warns 

https://news.sky.com/story/coronavirus-just-6-of-britons-have-antibodies-and-levels-wane-over-two-months-sage-warns-12075251

>WHO: Coronavirus Immunity Passports Shouldn’t Be Used Because of Reinfection Risk

https://nationalinterest.org/blog/coronavirus/who-coronavirus-immunity-passports-shouldn%E2%80%99t-be-used-because-reinfection-risk

>Covid-19 re-infection causes village closure in Shandong, China

https://fr.theepochtimes.com/cas-de-reinfection-covid-19-provoque-fermeture-dun-village-a-shandong-chine-1539857.html

>Coronavirus: psychosis sets in after the announcement of (15) cases of reinfection by the ANSS!

https://universciences.com/coronavirus-la-psychose-sinstalle-apres-lannonce-des-cas-de-reinfection-par-lanss/

>USP confirms case of Covid-19 reinfection; more than 60 are under analysis

https://www.cnnbrasil.com.br/saude/2020/09/20/usp-confirma-caso-de-reinfeccao-porus-covid-19-mais-de-60-seguem-em-analise

**Signifcant quotes from Oxford University:**

**A Case of Early Re-infection with SARS-CoV-2**. From the PDF:

>The clinical, epidemiological, and sequencing data of this case suggest early re-infection with SARS- CoV-2, only 51 days after resolution of initial infection. Importantly, this was observed in a young immunocompetent patient. In contrast to the case reported by To et al., **this second infection was more severe**, potentially due to immune enhancement, **acquisition of a more pathogenic strain**, or perhaps a greater inoculum of infection as the second exposure was from within the household.

https://academic.oup.com/cid/advance-article/doi/10.1093/cid/ciaa1436/5908892

COVID-19 **re-infection by a phylogenetically distinct SARS-coronavirus-2 strain confirmed** by whole genome sequencing

>Our **results suggest SARS-CoV-2 may continue to circulate among the human populations despite herd immunity** due to natural infection or vaccination.

https://academic.oup.com/cid/advance-article/doi/10.1093/cid/ciaa1275/5897019

author: prplput
body:
I'm a TSLA bear but everyone saying S&P is now impossible for this quarter just look at last September's index news.

There were 4 separate days with announcements of additions to the S&P 500.

LVS announced 9/26, PCRX on 9/24, NVR on 9/20, and CDW on 9/17

Dunno why everyone thinks it's a done deal. They've also said they can add components at any time...doesn't have to be on a scheduled rebalancing day.

Tesla i was hedging since the split announcement, figured it would follow apples footsteps in percentage gains but surpassed it with retarded strength. Could have made alot more on tesla pre-split rise but constantly paper handed it.

author: curiouscat887
body:
Basically my strategy is to look at the earning calls for the week, on the day the companies earnings are announced I usually search for that ticker and see if there are any alerts.

Something with high volume and low IO that’s quite far out with a short expiry looks like a bet to me so I look into the company a bit more and then follow the bet. 

I know it’s not rock solid but these are gambles after all.

Most have made something like 20-30% within a few hours later. 

I missed the CRM one even tho I was going to do it, kicking myself for that, but with the ZM one I thought why not as it was 1.35 a contract.

Just wish I put 10k into it as I’d have 400k now and could retire on theta haha but hindsight is 20/20

author: clmohn
body: I lost 40k today on tesla... I was all puts and call credit spreads expecting an offering on Monday after the close... then offering hit Tuesday morning, super pumped, went down 5% and I flipped long at 475 before the close... well that didn't go so well.  I am currently long going into tomorrow.  I think we will have a rebound.  It seemed VERY strange to me that every damn ticker was green today except tesla, apple, zoom, and salesforce.... that's some hard rotation and seems fishy to me.

author: nebuloushazybull
body:
For all you asking: “Wait, how tf did [insert CRWD, RKT, CLDR, etc] tank & ZM 🚀 to fucking 40%?”

And being like: “Fuck this market, this is rigged, it can’t be like that, etc.” 

Quit your bitching and process one thing and process it well. Read it 10-1000 times if you have to.

We’re in a fucking pandemic. Only the top dogs/upcoming and unfortunately overvalued as fuck monsters like ZM & CRM are gonna dominate and destroy agenda-related items like quarterly earnings. Their leaders and engineers don’t give a shit about how much their shares have gone up this past month or year. Even if they do; they care much more about making their products or services the only and most attractive offering in their domain.

Stop latching on to what you heard or what you think you may know of a company. If it’s not the top of its game or the leader in what it’s doing, even if new or old, assess against the current situation and play accordingly.

Yes ZM & CRM may not deserve the followed surges but hey, is anyone gonna need any less of either of these 2, especially during these times? Prolly not.

Cheers.

author: SnooRobots6193
body:
Just looking at some of the biggest top performers this year:

* AMZN PE Sept 2016: 192 (now 127)
* FB PE Sept 2016: 57 (now 34)
* CRM PE Sept 2016: 240 (now 99)
* NFLX PE Sept 2016: 310 (now 87)
* ABMD PE Sept 2016: 130 (now 80)
* DPZ PE Sept 2016: 41 (now 34; not a tech giant, but I bring it up cause it's among the most overlooked top performer of 2010s IMO).

And I didn't choose to compare with 2016 because it was some peak. The market climbed pretty much the entirety of 2017.

Obviously this list was handpicked and there are plenty of counterexamples, but the point is that growth companies have had growth priced in (and delivered on it) for many years.

So I got lucky! But only because I missed CRM last week, I got an alert for unusual volume from an app I use ( I have no affiliation) and passed on it and it would have bagged me 20k so I have severe regret, I also missed out on 28k by selling my Tesla call for $500 profit and 3 days later it was worth $28k. 

I didn’t wanna miss out again this time so when I got another alert for this and one for tsla, I chose this as it was cheaper and luckily won, wish I put more money in it haha but can’t be greedy! 

The Tsla one also did well too.

author: targetfan76
body:
Rare targetfan76 post about potential good stock for tomorrow earnings, doubt anyone cares.

$Zuo fairly small cloud billing server company (just like $CRM). $Crm crushed earnings and zuo went up 10% that day last week. Zoom had insane revenue and their billing is provided by $Zuo.  $crm crushing earnings + $zm crushing earnings = $zuo crushing earnings is my theory.

Zuo earnings tomorrow after market close and stock up 13% today and 5% after hours so might be too late to buy calls, maybe long dated calls out. If you want to buy in I think buying stock almost 100% makes you some money..

author: infinitelimits00
body:
So this is the theoretical explanation. Basically the IV increased so much to overwhelm any loss of delta, which is quite a big move in itself. So essentially a ton of people bought a ton of upside calls today could account for this massive IV increase. 

However, from a trading perspective this seems super exploitable. Essentially here's what it's implying. 

It's saying Yesterday there was an X % chance for Tesla to be > 800 (or pick any other upside strike) by September 18. Now Today, despite Tesla going down 4-5% at this current point, there is still an X % chance or even > X% chance for Tesla to be > 800 by September 18. That's insane!

Despite 1 day passing by and a 4-5% drop in stock, the probability, according to MM, didn't change or even increased at certain points in the day! And it's not like there's that many days until September 18 anyways.

I feel like this isn't a supply/demand issue. I think actually it's possible this market got broken due to outsized, black swan moves from stocks like CRM, ZM and DOCU who didn't even have an earnings yet that MM are so pressed to selling vol they jacked up everything arbitrarily across all names, which includes Tesla and CRM but should include others, which I haven't delved into.

author: infinitelimits00
body:
I don't think there would be many links talking about this but ZeroHedge did mention the call skew effect in tech in a recent article. I know it's ZeroHedge and they are permabears, but the data seems accurate. Essentially MM are so short calls right now that calls in some names cost 4x as much as puts the same strike away from spot. So a move like CRM or ZM to the upside makes the move like 5x larger. 

https://www.zerohedge.com/markets/apples-market-cap-surpasses-entire-russell-2000-due-option-insanity

author: OptionExpiration
body:
Since you worked at SIG, let's use the poker analogy. We know that retail has been buying calls across the board. We are short gamma and short so many calls. So we don't want to sell any more options at an x volatility. So retail keeps on buying at x+y and then x+y+z, etc. We keep on making sales at these 'inflated' prices and they keep on buying them.

I presume this phenomena is happening in AAPL. Got steamrolled in CRM (what a move) and ZM (today). So we keep on offering at higher and higher levels (and retail keeps on buying) which is nuts.

Because the big tech stocks make up a huge portion on the NDX (QQQ) and SPX (SPY), we can get a little hedge on buy bidding up calls in the NDX (QQQ) and SPX (SPY). Because we are bidding up calls, we are now impacting VIX.

This is the only explanation I have for you. I think you are probably OK selling a little vol here (but I would go smaller size because of this craziness... vol can still go higher).

author: OptionExpiration
body:
My feeling is that there is genuine panic at these market making firms because of these insane moves that just do not make sense (but they still continue because of the feedback loop). I would bet that a senior trader/partner has taken over these names (TSLA AAPL CRM FB GOOG etc) to make sure that the firm doesn't get clobbered too much.

We all know to respect the markets, but at some level the 'madness' has to end. Of course, nobody knows when that will happen. Notwithstanding, the 'edge' you get selling at x+y+z volatility is more than you got at x+y which is more than what you got at x. You may be wrong at the x and x+y levels, but at the x+y+z level you made up for your losses (from x and X+y) and then some. Thus, the snowball effect of implied volatility becoming actual volatility might be true at the x and x+y level and overstated at the x+y+z level. (There has to be some edge selling options because you need a balance sheet selling options versus buying options).

So I do agree with what you are saying that the implieds will eventually be overstating what is happening with actual volatility. Unfortunately, nobody knows what level this will be. Thus, selling vol in small pieces at higher and higher levels is probably the safest way of doing this (and this is probably what the market makers are doing). You should have enough edge that you can scratch a trade if it doesn't feel right...

I have $12,000 allocated to averaging down on current positions if necessary and nearly 1/3rd of my portfolio available for new positions. Today was awesome! author: KneeGrowsToes
body:
BB is representative of Canada as our top cyber security work and we are respected by many other countries, not just the US. The difference between CRWD and BB is the latter does not go after small fry. 


https://www.blackberry.com/us/en/company/newsroom/press-releases/2020/the-united-states-air-force-chooses-blackberry-spark-for-secure-productivity

When the entire world had to go remote overnight, many companies didn’t anticipate the massive surge of hacking attempts that occurred from all over the world. All it takes is someone who knows how to do it over Discord, and that person shows the next. It’s like virtual COVID. That expensive lesson is going be paid for when they realize ransom is a real threat in this world.

There’s a reason 9/10 major Canadian banks use them.

I am holding 10c and 20c for Jan 21. I want to profit as much as possible if this breaks out and is valued correctly. People still think they make phones. Even though they are releasing 5G phones from an American Manufacturer next year, it’s a drop in the bucket compared to QNX licensing and Spark UEM registrations. 18 of 20 G20 countries use Spark and they are the only product on DoD Approved Product List (and said by them the only product WORTH being on the list). I think this stock is gonna surpass CRWD in share price and Mkt cap soon. It’s been rebranded and updated as Spark UEM. They just hired Tom Eacobacci as President in June after he lead sales for Citrix for over 20 years and he gets to crank start the sales engine exactly how he wants. BlackBerry trades at 2-3x sales when CRWD trades at 30x. I am very confident they are gonna hit a massive beat Thursday BMO.

The purchase of Cylance was for a steal if you count the number of cyber security professionals they got with it. The demand for that talent during this pandemic was sky high and BlackBerry has the cash to pay them. With a centralized company, they only need one legal team, one accounting team. 
BB is representative of Canada as our top cyber security work and we are respected by many other countries, not just the US. The difference between CRWD and BB is the latter does not go after small fry.

author: EightFolding
body:
My top performers are: AAPL, FB, MSFT, MU, ACA, VWSYF, CTXS, TRN, MRVL, INO, CSCO, DOX, SNY, ABB. All with total gains over 40%. Those are *not* my recommendations, just my top performing holdings.

I'm self taught and ignorant about a lot, but try to learn. But I do have an investing philosophy. One of the big investing mistakes I think we all make is believing that how things are now is how they will always be, so I try to buy for a better future. And along with fundamentals I buy what I believe in, and what I've seen and used.

I do socially responsible self-directed investing. So I try not to buy anything that makes money directly from fossil fuels, war, harming people or animals,, prisons, poor treatment of immigrants, refugees, or asylum seekers, or, predatory financial industries, or any other industries that cause people, animals, or the environment harm. I think there's a fair argument to make that I'm breaking this rule to include tech companies like Facebook and some biotech, so that's my failure to work on. But my investments since the early 2000s have beat all the markets, and all the funds, just by choosing to have principles and trying to invest in companies that do good.

I also own other green energy, tech, grocery, railroads, data/commercial real estate, biotech. In the early 2000s I bought the companies that have become big tech, right now I'm buying transportation, biotech, 5G, AR, VR, and green energy companies along with companies I think will do well during the upcoming COVID-19 repeat. Despite the awful world we live in, I believe a better future is possible.

author: totsnotbiased
body:
The first thing I would do is double your interest in every ETF/ actively managed funds you own outside the S&P 500, and sell the small positions you have in low growth companies like J&J, JPM, KO, CTXS. 

A good rule of thumb for you might be if you can’t see a world where the stock could double in the next 12-24 months, you shouldn’t hold less than .5% of your total portfolio in it.

You’re highly diversified, but that’s what ETF’s are for, and they are probably better at it than any of us
